Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, interior very worn, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393214) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393214)
